title: "doesn't have a size known at compile-time" should point to the type alias' definition, not its usage

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hii! :wave:

Given the following code:

```rust
struct Wrapper<T>(T);

trait Foo {
    //
}

type FooWrapper = Wrapper<dyn Foo>;

fn unwrap(foo: Box<FooWrapper>) {
    //
}
```

([playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=c45fafb7e475d1c7e0326a8361cd9d3a))

... the current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `(dyn Foo + 'static)` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:123:456
  |
9 | fn unwrap(foo: Box<FooWrapper>) {
  |                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `(dyn Foo + 'static)`
note: required by a bound in `Wrapper`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:16
  |
1 | struct Wrapper<T>(T);
  |                ^ required by this bound in `Wrapper`
```

Without the context that `FooWrapper` is a type alias, pointing out at `Box<FooWrapper>` seems to be misleading, since on its own, `Box<T>` doesn't require for its `T` to be `Sized`.

How about this one?

```
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `(dyn Foo + 'static)` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/lib.rs:123:456
  |
7 | type FooWrapper = Wrapper<dyn Foo>;
  |                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `(dyn Foo + 'static)`
note: required due to use of `FooWrapper` here
 --> src/lib.rs:123:456
  |
9 | fn unwrap(foo: Box<FooWrapper>) {
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^^
note: required by a bound in `Wrapper`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:16
  |
1 | struct Wrapper<T>(T);
  |                ^ required by this bound in `Wrapper`
```

Getting this error message right given a generic type alias is tricky:

```rust
type FooWrapper<T> = Wrapper<T>;

fn unwrap<T>(foo: Box<FooWrapper<T>>)
where
    T: ?Sized
{
    //
}
```

... but I think it might just work, too:

```
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `T` cannot be known at compilation time
  |
7 | type FooWrapper<T> = Wrapper<T>;
  |                      ^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
note: required due to use of `FooWrapper<T>` here
  |
9 | fn unwrap<T>(foo: Box<FooWrapper<T>>)
  |           -           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |           |
  |           this type parameter needs to be `std::marker::Sized`
note: required by a bound in `Wrapper`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:16
  |
1 | struct Wrapper<T>(T);
  |                ^ required by this bound in `Wrapper`
```
I semi-like using `require` in both error messages, but I haven't been able to come up with a better terminology myself (stems / origins - or maybe without `require` at all, just `due to use ...`?).
